dct_provenance_s: Robert F. Blakely derived the original code set used during the collection of the seismic data so that the information could be saved to magnetic tape. The original data set was compiled in the field and interpreted by Joseph F. Whaley. The data set was then transferred into a more modern format (Microsoft Excel spreadsheet) and deciphered using the original code set by Christina James under the guidance of Walter Hasenmueller. Additional editorial checks were made by Karen Like with assistance from Robert F. Blakely. The Indiana Geological Survey employed all of the aforementioned people at the time of service.
dc_description_s: SEISMIC_DATA_IN is a point shapefile created from a shapefile named SEISMIC_DATA, which was derived from a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named SEISMIC_DECODED. The spreadsheet contains seismic shot information (13,949 points) collected by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) across Indiana.
dc_title_s: Seismic Refraction Data for Indiana: Indiana, 2002
